captions.text:
Hello. My name is Nancy Cusick. I'm a professional
dog trainer in Austin, Texas. You can visit

my website at trainmydogs.com. Today we're
going to show you how to teach your dog to

lay down. There are three ways to get behaviors
to happen. One is by luring your dog into

position. You can use food, you can use toys
and lure them. Niah. So we're going to lure

Niah into her sit position. And then we're
going to take the treat and lure it down the

front of her chest and her body's going to
go into a down. Once they do we mark it with

a yes and give her reward. Good girl. Good
job. Repetition is important when training

dogs to do new behaviors. So we're going to
show her several times how to lay down. We're

also going to incorporate a hand signal. I
don't like to teach dogs the word yet until

they've learned how to do the behavior. One
of the reasons is you're going to sit there

and chant down, down, down and the dog may
not know how to lay down yet. So we're going

to make sure that you can bet twenty bucks
that the dog will do the behavior before we

add the word. So once we get this going on.
Niah come? Good girl. Ready? Yes. Good job.

Come? Good girl. And each time. Sit. We're
going to start to raise our hand signal. Yes.

Before we give that reward. Come? Good. Until
we can get it.
Yes. Good girl. And that's how you teach your

title: Dog Training : How to Train Your Dog to Lie Down

comments.text: i got a new dog yesterday and it did it first day﻿
comments.author: the Minecarts

comments.text: My Yorkie just stands back up. Have any tips?﻿
comments.author: Felicia Apodaca

comments.text:
Start with your dog in a sitting position. Hold a piece of food directly in 
front of his nose. Say your dog's name and quickly move the piece of food 
to the floor right next to the dog's front paws. As the dog slides down to 
get the food say "down". Make sure you move the food right next to the 
dog's paws, because if the food is too far away the dog will get up to move 
to the food.﻿
comments.author: barkingmadtraining

comments.text:
Guys, the reason why your dogs are not doing it might be because you might 
not be bringing their nose to the ground or you are moving the treat to 
fast. Always remember to only reward your dog if they are in the correct 
position. It takes lots of patience! Good luck! :)

comments.text:
It took me awhile, but I got it. I think it was hard because my dog is a 
corgi and there's not much distance from his nose to the ground, so he 
didn't feel the need to lie down to get the treat. But after a few 
repetitions he figured it out. Thanks for posting!
comments.author: mowmowisgod

comments.text:
BTW: After the 10th time of teaching her the signal and forcing her into 
"down" position, I decided I would wait for her to do it on her own. I 
waited for a good 30 seconds and was patient. Sure enough, she eventually 
went down on her own. The rest is history. Once you decide you did enough 
"forcing" down, let them figure it out if it looks like they're really 
trying to figure it out.
comments.author: boochy115

comments.text:
My dog doesn't go down when I use a treat or toy. She just politely stares 
at the treat. The way it worked for me is I said the word and the hand 
signal once and made sure she paid attention. The next time I physically 
took her front legs and forced her into a "down" position while saying 
"down" and rewarded her immediately. After 10 times of doing this, she now 
does it on her own. Just a tip for those whose dogs do not lie down on 
their own at first...
comments.author: boochy115

the key to dog training is to keep your cool dont say a command 20 times

comments.author: Jackie M

comments.text:
i dont need treats to train my dog just act like you guys are in the army 
and your the sargent keep your voice higher than usual sharp and firm and 
say sit then down while showing the dog by putting the dog in the position 
to lay down by grabbing the front legs down or push the front back down 
until they lie down then say down and good and keep doing it a few times 
then tell them sit and then with your hand point down in front of them 
until they lie down then when they lie down praise them

comments.text:
What I do is show the dog the treat, but I don't drag the treat down to the 
floor close to the dog's body. If you watch a dog lie down its head moves 
forward. Instead, I pull the treat away and down from my dog's nose. Try 
that! :)

extremely food motivated), and then try to keep it close to her body when 
dragging it down to the floor. She would then stop looking at the treat and 
just look at me. I even tried pulling her legs to the floor but she'd just 
sit up right again.

comments.text: this worked thanks
comments.author: XbL Bad Oman

comments.text:
I was able to get this to work for one of my dogs. If you can't get it to 
work, you are probably doing what I did. You just laid the treat on the 
floor. When she sits, bring it by her nose and bring it DOWN HER CHEST, 
going to the floor., Once you do that, start to pull the treat towards you. 
That should make her lay down.
